snippet: Alex Karras, who played for the Detroit Lions from 1958 to 1970, was an intense tackle with a disdain for authority and scowl to be feared.
abstract: Box Seats article by author and Detroit native Bill Morris remembers Alex Karras, former Detroit Lions defensive lineman who died at age 77; notes that Karras had a disdain for authority as well as quarterbacks, and that he played his entire career for the Lions, from 1958 to 1970, missing only one game to injury.
lead_paragraph: Alex Karras, who played for the Detroit Lions from 1958 to 1970, was an intense tackle with a disdain for authority and scowl to be feared.

headline.seo: Alex Karras Played Role of League Outlaw for Lions
headline.main: A League Outlaw With an Endearing Scowl
headline.print_headline: A League Outlaw With an Endearing Scowl
